name: Hotel Vendome

reviews.text: What a little gem. A bit difficult initially to find as hidden away behind a row of shops built in what was its main entrance! The hotel is enchanting. The staff on the desk were friendly and very helpful. There were four of us - two couples, arriving at different times and leaving on different days! Thought that might give them problems - but everything went perfectly. We had rooms on the top floor with large (but basic) balconies - unexpected but most welcome. The rooms were both lovely, clean and with everything you needed. Breakfast was super. A great continental buffet breakfast with plenty of everything, constantly refreshed. The dining room is small, so best to get there early just to make sure of a seat. Ten minutes walk to the Promenade des Anglais and all attractions. Five minutes walk from the bus station - 20 minutes from rail station.
reviews.title: Lovely, friendly hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights. Tucked out of the way, friendly staff who spoke good english. A loverly building, very french. Had a great room with a balcony on the first floor (room 102)
reviews.title: VERY GOOD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could do with a bit of TLC in places but good value we thought.
reviews.title: Very good hotel for a week in Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week's holiday in Hotel vendome. We were not pleased with the first 2 rooms offered...first one on 4th floor ...very tiny and little light, 2nd one on 2nd floor..a bit bigger but less light. My husband continued to ask for something better and we eventually got an excellent room on 5th floor...Room 504...worth mentioning!!!! A huge and lovely bathroom, a tiny hallway for coats...a huge balcony with table and chairs( if we'd wanted breakfast in our room for example. ) A fair bit of space for moving around and a light and airy room. We were delighted!!!!! It has to be said however that there was a problem with the occasional ant...they must have lived in the walls...and got through the cracks...which we eventually tried to block as well as we could!!!! There was tea/coffee facilities as well which is unusual in a French hotel from our experience. Hotel staff very pleasant and helpful! The breakfast was excellent although the breakfast lounge was too small for the numbers using it. It was continental breakfast but with cereals and yoghurt in addition. Nice is a beautiful city with plenty to do and see. Weather was excellent in 2nd week of september...it broke as we were leaving....
reviews.title: Potentially a lovely hotel, but overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice beaches are pretty horrible....big stones!!!!! But if you were willing to take a train along the coast to Antibes or any of several resorts along the coast...eg Cannes and nearabouts....there was beautiful sandy beaches. Trains very easy to use and cheap!!! Monte Carlo is worth a trip for only 3-4 euros...and 20 minutes trip...but just do the prince's Palace and the old town..they are very attractive and worth a look!!!.the coast is very built up just now...you can see very little..and the noise of construction..as well as dust make it quite unpleasant. Most expensive beer of the holiday in square behing the Casino....7 euros each for 1/2 pint!!!!!!
reviews.title: Good location, could be good.....but

reviews.text: booked the hotel through their site, arrived on time only to find out they overbooked and offered to send me to a hotel "around the corner" that was actually 6 blocks away. they did not offer transportation. but the worst part is that they told me the other hotel (Grand Hotel de Florence) was more expensive, and that they were doing me a great favor by not charging me the difference. of course, when i arrived and asked the hotel their rates, they were 20 Euro cheaper. I had to then get on the phone and haggle with the manager to get my money back by walking back to the Hotel Vendome. a horrible experience, and probably something this hotel does often, where they get to capture additional revenue by upselling more inexpensive hotels to people who don't know better to check the rate.
reviews.title: Bad Business Strategy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk to the beach or the bus station, within easy reach of everything one really wants to visit! Matisse museum is 10-15 minutes away by bus (bus stop 3 minutes walk), Old Nice about 10 minutes walk as well.
reviews.title: Not a bad place to stay

likes.disliked: — noise from corridor and other rooms

reviews.text: The room was recently renovated, light with high seilings, a bit small though, very plain basic decor (which was a bit disappointing for this kind of historical building but OK), balcony was a plus, bathroom was sparkling clean and new, great shower (with very unreliable showerscreen though).
reviews.title: Needs much improvement
Excellent all round hotel with ample breakfasts!
reviews.text: Some details really make the room look cheap (like plastic cups instead of glasses for drinks or bathroom), or lack of bedside chests to keep trinkets and pyjamas in. Lift was quite small (3 slim people could squeeze in but not more). The sound insulation of the balcony was very good , but not of the rest (we were blessed with quiet neighbours in the first 3 days of our stay, last 2 days we were not, so no good sleep in the end).

reviews.title: Lovely old hotel
reviews.text: The reception staff were very helpful. The maids were doing job OK, but opened the door without knocking - a bit embarrasing.

reviews.text: Stayed in Hotel Vendome for 2 nights at end of Feb ’10 at the time of the Nice Carnival. This was a coincidence for us that the Carnival was on and the city was buzzing.
reviews.title: Excellent for the money we paid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and a friend booked B&B rate through travel republic at 50GBP per night and spent our weekend in Nice, Cannes and Monaco. Nice surpassed them both as a quaint little town with a lot to see and a lot going on.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location, nice staff
Hotel Vendome (Nice)
reviews.text: The hotel was in a fantastic location for the city centre and the old town and promenade. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Walls were quite thin and neighbors woke us in the morning as they left their rooms but we were glad of the alarm to encourage us to start the day and we found no problems at night. Breakfast was good with a selection of 3 cereals, a big bowl of fruit salad, orange juice, ham, cheese and warm scrambled egg, a selection of white and brown bread rolls, pastries/croissants and delicious local jams. Coffee was out of a machine and teabags and milk provided.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was only 1 elevator and its an old building with a lot of old original features. A possible problem for some, no problem to us as everything functioned as intended. We were able to park our rental car on the premises at a rate per day and the staff were very friendly and helpful with advice and suggestions.
reviews.title: I really liked my stay at the Vendome

reviews.text: I plan to recommend this hotel to family and friends and intend to return there myself. Great value for money.
reviews.title: Lovely, beautiful Hotel, extremely helpful reception staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our three night stay at the Vendome. The location is fantastic- five minutes to the old town and five minutes to the train station. The rooms are a little small but it has everything you need. We were upgraded to a top floor room with a terrace! The service is excellent and the breakfast(despite other reviews) is great! There are many good restaurants to choose from notably "The Pelican". We are looking forward to our next stay in Nice and at the Hotel Vendome.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel,fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a trip to NICE, stayed in the Vendome hotel. Not much to shout about there comfortwise but the staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are very small - just enough room to get around - bed very comfortable though. Breakfast room is another story - don't expect much - it's very cramped - seats about 20 persons and if you get into one of the inner seats you wont be able to get out unless everyone around you gets up to let you move. Expect to wait for a while - there's not enough seating at busy times.
reviews.title: Bare essentials

reviews.text: The hotel is approx 500 metres from the beach - it's not on a hill so no problem to walkers.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel - Want to go back

reviews.text: The city is beautiful and well worth taking the open topped tour bus - goes for approx 1.5 hours and you get to see all the sights - commentary in various languages included via headphones.
reviews.title: Disappointing Overall

likes.liked: — Location - average 15 mins walk from everywhere important
likes.disliked: — Service, small rooms, service, squeaky floors, service, paper-thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels advertise day trips to Monaco/Monte Carlo and Cannes - these are approx 70 euro per person for about half a day - forget these - the train station is about 1 kilometer from the hotel - you can go to Monaco/Monte Carlo for 3.30 euro per person return and take all the time you like there - trains go every hour all day - likewise if you want to go to Cannes and see how the filmstars live - it costs just over 5 euro return and its only about a half hours journey- well worth going to see these places, they are something else. Any body need any other info - please contact me
reviews.title: Great location, lovely staff
